companyProfile.companyDescription: Reliance Industries Limited is engaged in the activities of hydrocarbon exploration and production, petroleum refining and marketing, petrochemicals, advanced materials and composites, renewables, retail and digital services. The Company’s segments include Oil to Chemicals (O2C), Oil and Gas, Retail, and Digital Services. The O2C segment covers refining, petrochemicals, fuel retailing, aviation fuel, and bulk wholesale marketing, with a portfolio that includes transportation fuels, polymers, polyesters, and elastomers. The Oil and Gas segment focuses on the exploration, development, and production of crude oil and natural gas. The Retail segment involves consumer retail and related services. The Digital Services segment provides a range of digital services. It also operates an oncology-focused healthcare platform, which focuses on technology-driven cancer care. Its subsidiaries include 7-India Convenience Retail Limited, Amante India Limited, Cover Story Clothing Limited, and others.

recentNews.headline: Reliance Q1 Results LIVE: Mukesh Ambani-led RIL likely to deliver strong earnings led by growth in O2C, Jio; stock eases
recentNews.intro: Reliance Q1 Results LIVE: Reliance Industries Q1 net profit is expected to see a strong one-off gain from the Asian Paints stake sale. The company?s consolidated  EBITDA is also likely to jump led by healthy performance of core verticals, such as oil-to-chemicals (O2C), telecom, and retail.
recentNews.imagecaption: Reliance Q1 Results LIVE: Reliance Industries shares have registered 20% year-to-date (YTD) gains.

recentNews.headline: Reliance subsidiary Reliance Retail acquires Kelvinator ahead of Q1 results today. Details here
recentNews.intro: Isha Ambani-led Reliance Retail announced the acquisition of refrigerator and washing machine manufacturer Kelvinator, a move to amplify its range of offerings in India?s fast-growing consumer durables sector.
recentNews.imagecaption: Reliance Retail's announcement of Kelvinator acquisition comes ahead of the release of Reliance Q1 results today.

recentNews.headline: Reliance Q1 results today: Street expects healthy earnings. Is it the right time to buy RIL stock?
recentNews.intro: Reliance Q1 results today: Reliance Industries is set to announce its Q1 earnings on July 18, with expectations of robust year-on-year growth in profit after tax and EBITDA. Reliance share price has gained 21 per cent this year so far.
recentNews.imagecaption: Reliance share rice has gained 21 per cent this year so far. Reliance Industries will report its Q1 results for the financial year 2025-26 on Friday, July 18. (Image: Pexel):

recentNews.headline: RIL Q1 preview: Profits have slowed, hype is building?can Reliance deliver this time?
recentNews.intro: India?s most valuable company faces investor pressure to deliver stronger earnings and update progress on its ambitious new energy ventures.
recentNews.imagecaption: Mukesh Ambani, Chairman and Managing Director of Reliance Industries. Reliance is going back to its roots in Jamnagar, where its refinery is located, to set up its new energy and AI infrastructure. (File Photo: ANI)

recentNews.headline: Reliance Jio may see steady revenue growth in Q1 on subscriber addition, IPL push
recentNews.intro: Reliance Jio offered a free 90-day JioHotstar subscription and free trials for its fibre broadband and fixed wireless access services during the quarter, helping boost user engagement during Q1FY26
recentNews.imagecaption: For Jio, average revenue per user (Arpu) has likely risen 1.6% sequentially. Photographed by Indranil Bhoumik/Mint

recentNews.headline: India?s biggest companies are underperforming FDs. Here's why Reliance is different.
recentNews.intro: Post-covid, many investors turned to blue-chip stocks but found disappointing returns. Reliance Industries stands out for its multi-year journey to transform itself from a petrochemicals giant to a consumer behemoth.
recentNews.imagecaption: The market is taking note of the transformation of Reliance Industries into a consumer behemoth.

recentNews.headline: Shares to buy in short term: Mehta Equities? Riyank suggests RIL, Tech Mahindra, Infosys stock to buy in near term
recentNews.intro: Indian equity markets opened positively after four days of decline, with Nifty 50 rising 0.14% and BSE Sensex increasing 0.10%. Analysts suggest buying on dips, with key support at 25,000 and resistance at 25,200, while recommending stocks like Reliance, Tech Mahindra, and Infosys.
recentNews.imagecaption: Shares to buy in short term: Mehta Equities? Riyank suggests RIL, Tech Mahindra, Infosys stock to buy in near term

recentNews.headline: Ola Electric puts cell PLI timeline on backburner amid profitability push
recentNews.intro: The delay in expanding beyond 5GWh capacity comes as the firm  pivots to a more profitability-centric approach than looking at aggressive penetration after reporting a 50% year-on-year drop in revenue to  ?828 crore and a surge in losses to  ?428 crore in the April-June period.
recentNews.imagecaption: Chief executive officer of Ola Electric Mobility Ltd Bhavish Aggarwal said the company will incur a maximum  ?100 crore penalty for not meeting PLI targets.

recentNews.headline: After Middle East, Reliance takes Campa to Nepal in partnership with Wai-Wai noodle maker
recentNews.intro: Earlier this year the company launched Campa in the UAE, marking its entry into international markets. The brand is now present in Oman, Bahrain and Qatar as well.
recentNews.imagecaption: In India, Campa has rolled out a  ?10 fizzy drink and partnered with with JioStar as a co-sponsor for IPL 2025, challenging incumbents such as Coca-Cola and PepsiCo. Illustration: Tarun Kumar Sahu/Mint

recentNews.headline: The king?s comeback: Why Reliance Industries is beating the market
recentNews.intro: RIL?s stock has soared 24% this year so far against a 7% rise in the benchmark Nifty, reversing two years of underperformance. What is making the  ?20-trillion market cap company dance? And, more importantly, can it sustain?
recentNews.imagecaption: Mukesh Ambani, chairman and managing director, RIL. Over the next five-seven years, he expects the conglomerate?s New Energy business to become as big and profitable as its O2C segment.  (Samir Jana/HT Archive)
